objects.name: Tank
objects.description: Player controllable tank, customizable based on class selection.
objects.special_rules: Objectives in stage 3 change depending on the selected tank class.

objects.name: Dummy Tank
objects.description: Stationary or moving targets for Shooting and Skill stages.
objects.special_rules: Does not shoot at the player. Future updates may include enemy tanks firing back.

systems.name: Moving System
systems.description: System to teach players how to move their tank using a joystick.
systems.mechanics: Player uses Move Joystick to navigate to checkpoints (Pins).
systems.objectives: Reach specified points on the map.

systems.name: Shooting System
systems.description: System to teach players how to shoot enemies using a joystick.
systems.mechanics: Player uses Shoot Joystick to destroy stationary or moving dummy tanks.

systems.name: Skill Usage System
systems.description: System to teach players how to use special skills based on their tank class.
systems.mechanics: Player uses Skill Button to perform specific actions like trapping or dragging enemy tanks.
systems.objectives: Complete skill-based tasks such as destroying, trapping, or dragging enemy tanks.

logic_rules.description: Player must reach all designated Pins to complete the Moving stage.
logic_rules.effect: Progress to the next stage of the tutorial.

logic_rules.description: Player must destroy all dummy tanks to complete the Shooting stage.
logic_rules.effect: Progress to the next stage of the tutorial.

logic_rules.description: Player must successfully use their skill to complete objectives like trapping or dragging enemy tanks.

requirements.title: Tutorial Progression Requirement
requirements.description: Ensure players can complete the tutorial by introducing mechanics in stages: Moving, Shooting, and Using Skills.
requirements.acceptance_criteria: Players must understand and complete each stage without confusion.

requirements.title: UI Display Requirement
requirements.description: Only display relevant UI elements for each stage of the tutorial.
requirements.acceptance_criteria: UI elements correspond to the current tutorial stage (e.g., Move Joystick in Moving stage).
